title: Update to .NET 10 SDK and restructure TFMs
body:
## Summary

Update SkiaSharp from .NET 8 to .NET 10, restructuring the TFM system and modernizing workload management.

## Changes (48 files)

### Build System
- **global.json**: Pin SDK to `10.0.103` with workload sets (`workloadVersion`)
- **SkiaSharp.Build.props**: Restructure TFM properties:
  - `TFMBase=net6.0` (class libs only)
  - `TFMPrevious=net9.0` (full platform support)
  - `TFMCurrent=net10.0` (full platform support)
  - Removed `TFMNext` entirely
- Remove MAUI TPV workaround (dotnet/maui#24263 fixed in .NET 9+)
- Add full `PlatformTargetFrameworksPrevious` block (was referenced but never defined)
- Add `MauiTargetFrameworksPrevious`, `MauiTargetFrameworksAppPrevious`, `UnoTargetFrameworksPrevious`

### Platform TPVs
| Platform | Previous (net9) | Current (net10) |
|----------|----------------|-----------------|
| Android | 35.0 | 36.0 |
| iOS/MacCatalyst/tvOS | 18.0 | 18.0 |
| macOS | 15.0 | 15.0 |
| Tizen | 7.0 | 7.0 |
| Windows | 10.0.19041.0 | 10.0.19041.0 |

### Workloads
- Replace `install-dotnet-workloads.ps1` with `dotnet workload restore` (pinned via global.json workload sets)
- Tizen Samsung custom scripts preserved as separate step
- Remove `DOTNET_VERSION_PREVIEW` variable and preview SDK install step (no longer needed — preview testing is done by shifting the TFM chain)
- Remove old dotnet6/7/8 preview feeds from `nuget.config`

### Pipelines
- `DOTNET_VERSION`: 8.0.304 → 10.0.103
- `XCODE_VERSION`: 15.4 → 16.2
- `EMSCRIPTEN_VERSION`: 3.1.34 → 3.1.56
- Test device versions updated for .NET 10 era
- WASM pipeline: added .NET 10 Emscripten entry

### Other
- 14 NativeAssets csproj files → `TFMPrevious;TFMCurrent` pattern
- 16 sample projects updated
- Cake build scripts: hardcoded TFMs + UpdateDocs ref package names
- Utility projects: net8.0 → net10.0
- New `documentation/updating-dotnet-version.md` — checklist for future .NET upgrades

## Notes
- TPVs should be verified against actual workload manifests after SDK install
- Gallery samples (net6/7 era Uno) intentionally left unchanged
- `IsTargetFrameworkCompatible('net7.0')` conditions are safe (floor check)
